59   | /**
60   |  **  Error weights
61   |  **/
62   | 
63   | typedef enum _err_weights	{
64   |     WGHT_NONE=0,			/** Dummy value: No error	     **/
65   |     WGHT_VERBOSE,			/** Verbose messages		     **/
66   |     WGHT_INFO=3,			/** Informal message	 	     **/
67   |     WGHT_DEBUG=5,			/** Debugger output		     **/
68   |     WGHT_WARN=10,			/** Warning: Prog. flow not affected **/
69   |     WGHT_PROB=20,			/** Problem: Prog. flow cond. aff.   **/
70   |     WGHT_ERROR=25,			/** Error and Fatal: Prog. flow aff. **/
71   |     WGHT_FATAL=27,			/**   Return to the caller	     **/
72   |     WGHT_PANIC=29			/** Panic: Exit program immediatelly **/
73   | } ErrWeights;
74   | 
75   | /**
76   |  **  Log facilities
77   |  **/
78   | 
79   | typedef	struct	_err_facility	{
80   |     ErrWeights	 Weight;		/** Error weight 		     **/
81   |     char	*facility;		/** Log facility		     **/
82   |     char	*def_facility;		/** Default facility (facility undef)**/
83   | } ErrFacilities;
84   | 
85   | typedef struct	_facil_names	{
86   |     char 	*name;			/** Name of a facility		     **/
87   |     int		 token;			/** Assigned token		     **/
88   | } FacilityNames;
89   | 
90   | /**
91   |  **  Error measurement table
92   |  **/
93   | 
94   | typedef	struct	{
95   |     ErrWeights	 error_weight;		/** The weight itsself		     **/
96   |     char	*message;		/** Message to be printed	     **/
97   |     ErrCode	 ret_nov,		/** Return code			     **/
98   | 		 ret_adv,
99   | 		 ret_exp;
100  | } ErrMeasr;
101  | 
102  | /**
103  |  **  Error code translation table
104  |  **/
105  | 
106  | typedef struct  { 
107  |     ErrType	  error_type;		/** The error type as specified by   **/
108  | 					/** the caller			     **/
109  |     ErrWeights    error_weight;		/** The weight of this error         **/
110  |     char	 *messages;		/** List of messages to be printed   **/
111  | } ErrTransTab;

232  | 	{ WGHT_PROB,	"PROB",		ERROR,		PROBLEM,	OK },

238  | /**
239  |  **  Error code translation table
240  |  **  Take care that this list is sorted in ascending order concerning the error
241  |  **  types.
242  |  **  Error weights (WGHT_*)
243  |  **	WARN	- warnings
244  |  **	PROB	- problems (normally the modulecmd may be completed)
245  |  **	ERROR	- errors (which normally leads to an unsuccessful end)
246  |  **	FATAL	- fatal system errors
247  |  **	PANIC	- very fatal system errors (internal program inconsistencies)
248  |  **/
249  |

369  | 				char		 *module,
370  | 				int		  lineno,
371  | 				ErrWeights	  Weight,
372  | 				char		 *WeightMsg,

375  | 				char		**argv);

379  | 				char		 *module,

392  | 				char		**Target,
393  | 				int		 *Length,
394  | 				int		  argc,
395  | 				char		**argv);

404  | 
405  | /*++++
406  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
407  |  ** 									     **
408  |  **   Function:		Module_Verbosity				     **
409  |  ** 									     **
410  |  **   Description:	Display a verbose message			     **
411  |  ** 									     **
412  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/27					     **
413  |  ** 									     **
414  |  **   Parameters:	int	result	Result code of the module command    **
415  |  **			int	argc	Number of arguments to the module    **
416  |  **					command				     **
417  |  **			char	**argv	Argument array			     **
418  |  **			char	*buffer	Print buffer			     **
419  |  ** 									     **
420  |  **   Result:		-						     **
421  |  ** 									     **
422  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
423  |  **						by the current command	     **
424  |  ** 									     **
425  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
426  |  ++++*/
427  | 
428  | void Module_Verbosity(
429  | 	int argc,
430  | 	char **argv
431  | ) {
432  | 	if (sw_verbose && argc && *argv)
433  | 		if (!FlushError
434  | 		    (NO_ERR_VERBOSE, g_current_module, linenum, WGHT_VERBOSE,
435  | 		     Measurements[MEAS_VERB_NDX].message, *argv, argc, argv)) {
436  | 			ErrorLogger(ERR_INTERRL, LOC, NULL);
437  | 		}
438  | 
439  | } /** End of 'Module_Verbosity' **/
440  | 
441  | /*++++
442  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
443  |  ** 									     **
444  |  **   Function:		Enable_Error, Disable_Error, Restore_Error	     **
445  |  ** 									     **
446  |  **   Description:	Enables, disables, or restores error logging	     **
447  |  ** 			Sometimes an error isn't really an error	     **
448  |  ** 									     **
449  |  **   First Edition:	1999/11/11					     **
450  |  ** 									     **
451  |  **   Parameters:	none						     **
452  |  ** 									     **
453  |  **   Result:		none						     **
454  |  ** 									     **
455  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
456  |  ++++*/
457  | 
458  | static void save_error_state(int reset) {
459  | 	static int in_effect = 0;
460  | 	static int saved_state = 0;
461  | 
462  | 	if (reset && in_effect ) {
463  | 		quiet_on_error = saved_state;
464  | 		in_effect = 0;
465  | 	} else if (!reset && !in_effect ) {
466  | 		saved_state = quiet_on_error;
467  | 		in_effect = 1;
468  | 	}
469  | }
470  | 
471  | 
472  | void Enable_Error(void) {
473  | 	save_error_state(0);
474  | 	quiet_on_error = 0;
475  | }
476  | 
477  | void Disable_Error(void) {
478  | 	save_error_state(0);
479  | 	quiet_on_error = 1;
480  | }
481  | 
482  | void Restore_Error(void) {
483  | 	quiet_on_error = 0;	/* the default is to output errors */
484  | 	save_error_state(1);
485  | }
486  | 
487  | /*++++
488  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
489  |  ** 									     **
490  |  **   Function:		Module_Error					     **
491  |  ** 									     **
492  |  **   Description:	Error handling for the modules package		     **
493  |  ** 									     **
494  |  **   First Edition:	1995/08/06					     **
495  |  ** 									     **
496  |  **   Parameters:	ErrType		 error_type	Type of the error    **
497  |  **			char		*module		Affected module	     **
498  |  **			int		 lineo		Line number	     **
499  |  **			...				Argument list	     **
500  |  ** 									     **
501  |  **   Result:		ErrCode		OK		No error	     **
502  |  **					PROBLEM		Problem. Program may **
503  |  **							continue running     **
504  |  **					ERROR		Caller should try to **
505  |  **							exit gracefully      **
506  |  ** 									     **
507  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
508  |  ** 									     **
509  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
510  |  ++++*/
511  | 
512  | int Module_Error(	ErrType		  error_type,
513  | 		   	char		 *module,
514  | 		   	int		  lineno,
515  | 		   	... )
516  | {
517  |     int		  listsize = ARGLIST_SIZE,	/** Initial size of the argu-**/
518  | 						/** ment list		     **/
519  | 		  argc = 0;			/** Actual number of args    **/
520  |     char	**argv,				/** Argument array	     **/
521  | 		 *arg;				/** A single argument	     **/
522  |     va_list	  parptr;			/** Varargs scan pointer     **/
523  |     ErrTransTab	 *TransPtr;			/** Error transtab entry     **/
524  |     ErrMeasr	 *MeasPtr;			/** Measurement pointer      **/
525  |     ErrCode	  ret_code;
526  |     int		  NoArgs = (error_type == ERR_ALLOC);
527  | 
528  |     if( quiet_on_error ) return OK;		/* do nothing - just OK */
529  | 
530  |     /**
531  |      **  Argument check
532  |      **/
533  |     if( NO_ERR_VERBOSE == error_type && !sw_verbose)
534  | 	return( OK);
535  | 
536  |     if( !module)
537  | 	module = _(em_unknown);
538  | 
539  |     /**
540  |      **  Build the argument array at first
541  |      **/
542  |     if( NULL == (argv = (char **) module_malloc(listsize * sizeof( char *)))) {
543  | 	module = module_name;
544  | 	error_type = ERR_ALLOC;
545  | 	NoArgs = 1;
546  |     }
547  | 
548  |     va_start( parptr, lineno);
549  |     while( !NoArgs && (NULL != (arg = va_arg( parptr, char *)))) {
550  | 
551  | 	/**
552  | 	 **  Conditionally realloc
553  | 	 **/
554  | 	while( argc >= listsize) {
555  | 	    listsize += ARGLIST_SIZE;
556  | 	    if( NULL == (argv = (char **) module_realloc( argv,
557  | 		listsize * sizeof(char *)))) {
558  | 		module = module_name;
559  | 		error_type = ERR_ALLOC;
560  | 		NoArgs = 1;
561  | 		break;
562  | 	    }
563  | 	}
564  | 
565  | 	argv[ argc++] = arg;
566  | 
567  |     } /** while **/
568  |     
569  |     if( NO_ERR_VERBOSE == error_type && !argc)
570  | 	return( OK);
571  | 
572  |     /**
573  |      **  Locate the error translation table entry according to the 
574  |      **  passed error type
575  |      **/
576  |     if( NULL == (TransPtr = ErrorLookup( error_type))) {
577  | 	if( argv)
578  | 	    null_free((void *) &argv);
579  | 	return( ErrorLogger( ERR_INVAL, LOC, (sprintf( buffer, "%d",
580  | 	    error_type), buffer), NULL));
581  |     }
582  |     
583  |     /**
584  |      **  Now locate the assigned error weight ...
585  |      **/
586  | 
587  |     if( NULL == (MeasPtr = MeasLookup( TransPtr->error_weight))) {
588  | 	if( argv)
589  | 	    null_free((void *) &argv);
590  | 	argc = 0;
591  | 	return( ErrorLogger( ERR_INVWGHT, LOC, (sprintf( buffer, "%d",
592  | 	    TransPtr->error_weight), buffer), NULL));
593  |     }
594  | 
595  |     /**
596  |      **  Use the return code as defined for the current user level
597  |      **/
598  |     switch( sw_userlvl) {
599  | 	case UL_NOVICE:
600  | 	    ret_code = MeasPtr->ret_nov;
601  | 	    break;
602  | 	case UL_ADVANCED:
603  | 	    ret_code = MeasPtr->ret_adv;
604  | 	    break;
605  | 	case UL_EXPERT:
606  | 	    ret_code = MeasPtr->ret_exp;
607  | 	    break;
608  |     }
609  | 
610  |     /**
611  |      **  Print the error message
612  |      **/
613  |     if( TransPtr->error_weight <= WGHT_DEBUG || ret_code != OK)
614  | 	if( !FlushError( error_type, module, lineno, TransPtr->error_weight,
615  | 	    MeasPtr->message, TransPtr->messages, argc, argv)) {
616  | 	    if( argv)
617  | 		null_free((void *) &argv);
618  | 	    argc = 0;
619  | 	    return( ErrorLogger( ERR_INTERRL, LOC, NULL));
620  | 	}
621  | 
622  |     /**
623  |      **  Return to the caller ... conditionally ...
624  |      **/
625  |     if( WARN == ret_code)
626  | 	ret_code = OK;
627  | 
628  |     if( argv)
629  | 	null_free((void *) &argv);
630  |     argc = 0;
631  | 
632  |     if( ret_code > ERROR)
633  | 	exit( ret_code);
634  | 
635  |     return( ret_code);
636  | } /** End of 'Module_Error' **/
637  | 
638  | /*++++
639  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
640  |  ** 									     **
641  |  **   Function:		ErrorLookup					     **
642  |  ** 									     **
643  |  **   Description:	Look up the passed error type in the translation tab.**
644  |  ** 									     **
645  |  **   First Edition:	1995/08/06					     **
646  |  ** 									     **
647  |  **   Parameters:	ErrType		 error_type	Type of the error    **
648  |  ** 									     **
649  |  **   Result:		ErrTransTab*	NULL	Not found		     **
650  |  **					else	Pointer to the acc. entry    **
651  |  ** 									     **
652  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
653  |  ** 									     **
654  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
655  |  ++++*/
656  | 
657  | static	ErrTransTab	*ErrorLookup(	ErrType error_type )
658  | {
659  |     ErrTransTab	*low, *mid, *high, *save;	/** Search pointers	     **/
660  | 
661  |     /**
662  |      **  Init serach pointers
663  |      **/
664  | 
665  |     low = TransTab;
666  |     high = TransTab + (sizeof( TransTab) / sizeof( TransTab[0]) -1);
667  |     mid = (ErrTransTab *) NULL;
668  | 
669  |     /**
670  |      **  Search loop
671  |      **/
672  | 
673  |     while( low < high) {
674  | 
675  | 	save = mid;
676  | 	mid = low + ((high - low) / 2);
677  | 	if( save == mid)
678  | 	    low = mid = high;			/** Just for safety ...	     **/
679  | 
680  | 	if( mid->error_type < error_type ) {
681  | 	    low = mid;
682  | 	} else if( mid->error_type > error_type ) {
683  | 	    high = mid;
684  | 	} else
685  | 	    return( mid);		/** Yep! Got it!		     **/
686  | 
687  |     } /** while **/
688  | 
689  |     /**
690  |      **  Maybe the loop has been finished before the comparison took place
691  |      **  (low == high) and hit!
692  |      **/
693  | 
694  |     if( mid->error_type == error_type )
695  | 	return( mid);               	/** Yep! Got it!                     **/
696  | 
697  |     /**
698  |      **  If this point is reached, nothing has been found ...
699  |      **/
700  | 
701  |     return( NULL);
702  | 
703  | } /** End of 'ErrorLookup' **/
704  | 
705  | /*++++
706  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
707  |  ** 									     **
708  |  **   Function:		MeasLookup					     **
709  |  ** 									     **
710  |  **   Description:	Look up the passed error weight in the measurement   **
711  |  **			table						     **
712  |  ** 									     **
713  |  **   First Edition:	1995/08/06					     **
714  |  ** 									     **
715  |  **   Parameters:	ErrWeights	weigth	Weight of the error	     **
716  |  ** 									     **
717  |  **   Result:		ErrMeasr*	NULL	Not found		     **
718  |  **					else	Pointer to the acc. entry    **
719  |  ** 									     **
720  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
721  |  ** 									     **
722  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
723  |  ++++*/
724  | 
725  | static	ErrMeasr	*MeasLookup(	ErrWeights weigth )
726  | {
727  |     ErrMeasr	*low, *mid, *high, *save;	/** Search pointers	     **/
728  | 
729  |     /**
730  |      **  Init serach pointers
731  |      **/
732  | 
733  |     low = Measurements;
734  |     high = Measurements + (sizeof( Measurements) / sizeof( Measurements[0]) -1);
735  |     save = (ErrMeasr *) NULL;
736  |     mid = (ErrMeasr *) NULL;
737  | 
738  |     /**
739  |      **  Search loop
740  |      **/
741  | 
742  |     while( low < high) {
743  | 
744  | 	save = mid;
745  | 	mid = low + ((high - low) / 2);
746  | 	if( save == mid)
747  | 	    low = mid = high;			/** Just to be sure ...      **/
748  | 
749  | 	if( mid->error_weight < weigth ) {
750  | 	    low = mid;
751  | 	} else if( mid->error_weight > weigth ) {
752  | 	    high = mid;
753  | 	} else
754  | 	    return( mid);		/** Yep! Got it!		     **/
755  | 
756  |     } /** while **/
757  | 
758  |     /**
759  |      **  Maybe the loop has been finished before the comparison took place
760  |      **  (low == high) and hit!
761  |      **/
762  | 
763  |     if( mid->error_weight == weigth )
764  | 	return( mid);               	/** Yep! Got it!                     **/
765  | 
766  |     /**
767  |      **  If this point is reached, nothing has been found ...
768  |      **/
769  | 
770  |     return( NULL);
771  | 
772  | } /** End of 'MeasLookup' **/
773  | 
774  | /*++++
775  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
776  |  ** 									     **
777  |  **   Function:		FlushError					     **
778  |  ** 									     **
779  |  **   Description:	Print the error message. Decide which facility to    **
780  |  **			use and schedule the according logger routine	     **
781  |  ** 									     **
782  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/21					     **
783  |  ** 									     **
784  |  **   Parameters:	ErrType		  Type		Error type as passed **
785  |  **			char		 *module	Module name	     **
786  |  **			int		  lineno	Line number	     **
787  |  **		  	ErrWeights	  Weight	Error Weight	     **
788  |  **			char		 *WeightMsg	Printable Weight     **
789  |  **			char		 *ErrMsgs	Error message	     **
790  |  **			int		  argc		Number of arguments  **
791  |  **			char		**argv		Argument array	     **
792  |  ** 									     **
793  |  **   Result:		int	1		Everything OK		     **
794  |  **				0		Error occured while printing **
795  |  ** 									     **
796  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
797  |  ++++*/
798  | 
799  | static	int	FlushError(	ErrType		  Type,
800  | 				char		 *module,
801  | 				int		  lineno,
802  | 				ErrWeights	  Weight,
803  | 				char		 *WeightMsg,
804  | 				char		 *ErrMsgs,
805  | 				int		  argc,
806  | 				char		**argv)
807  | {
808  |     char	*facilities;
809  |     char 	*fac;
810  |     FILE	*facfp;
811  |     char	*errmsg_buffer, *fac_buffer;
812  | 
813  |     /**
814  |      **  get the error facilities at first. If there isn't any, we may
815  |      **  return on success immediatelly.
816  |      **/
817  |     if((char *) NULL == (facilities = GetFacility( Weight)))
818  | 	goto success0;
819  | 
820  |     /**
821  |      **  copy the facilities string so we can do some changes in it
822  |      **/
823  |     if((char *) NULL == (fac_buffer = stringer(NULL, 0, facilities, NULL))) {
824  | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
825  | 	goto unwind0;
826  |     }
827  | 
828  |     /**
829  |      **  Print the error message into the buffer
830  |      **/
831  |     if((char *) NULL == (errmsg_buffer = stringer(NULL, ERR_BUFSIZE, NULL))) {
832  | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
833  | 	goto unwind1;
834  |     }
835  | 
836  |     /**
837  |      **  In case of verbosity, the first argument is the ErrMsgs format string
838  |      **/
839  |     if( WGHT_VERBOSE == Weight) {
840  | 	ErrMsgs = *argv++;
841  | 	--argc;
842  |     }
843  | 
844  |     if( !PrintError( errmsg_buffer, Type, module, lineno, Weight,
845  | 	WeightMsg, ErrMsgs, argc, argv))
846  | 	    goto unwind2;
847  | 
848  |     /**
849  |      **  Now tokenize the facilities string and schedule the error message
850  |      **  for every single facility
851  |      **/
852  |     for( fac = xstrtok( fac_buffer, ":");
853  | 	 fac;
854  | 	 fac = xstrtok( (char *) NULL, ":") ) {
855  | 
856  | 	/**
857  | 	 **  Check for filenames. Two specials are defined: stderr and stdout
858  | 	 **  Otherwise filenames are expected to begin on '.' or '/'.
859  | 	 **  Everthing not recognized as a filename is assumed to be a
860  | 	 **  syslog facility
861  | 	 **  'null' and 'none' are known as 'no logging'
862  | 	 **/
863  | 	if( !strcmp( fac, _null) || !strcmp( fac, _none))
864  | 	    continue;
865  | 
866  | 	else if( !strcmp( fac, _stderr))
867  | 	    fprintf( stderr, "%s", errmsg_buffer);
868  | 	
869  | 	else if( !strcmp( fac, _stdout)) 
870  | 	    fprintf( stdout, "%s", errmsg_buffer);
871  | 
872  | 	/**
873  | 	 **  Syslog
874  | 	 **/
875  | 	else if( '.' != *fac && '/' != *fac) {
876  | #if defined(HAVE_SYSLOG) && defined(WITH_LOGGING)
877  | 	    int syslog_fac, syslog_lvl;
878  | 
879  | 	/* now send to syslog */
880  | 	    if( CheckFacility( fac, &syslog_fac, &syslog_lvl)) {
881  | 		openlog( "modulecmd", LOG_PID, syslog_fac);
882  | 		setlogmask( LOG_UPTO( syslog_lvl));
883  | 		syslog( (syslog_fac | syslog_lvl), "%s", errmsg_buffer);
884  | 		closelog();
885  | 
886  | 	    /**
887  | 	     **  Invalid facilities ... take care not to end up in 
888  | 	     **  infinite loops
889  | 	     **/
890  | 	    } else if( Type == ERR_INVFAC ||
891  | 	               OK == ErrorLogger( ERR_INVFAC, LOC, fac, NULL)) 
892  | 		continue;
893  | #endif
894  | 	}
895  | 
896  | 	/**
897  | 	 **  Custom files ...
898  | 	 **  This may result from the syslog part above
899  | 	 **/
900  | 	if( '.' == *fac || '/' == *fac) {
901  | 	    if((FILE *) NULL == (facfp = fopen( fac, "a"))) {
902  | 
903  | 		if( WGHT_PANIC == Weight)	/** Avoid endless loops!     **/
904  | 		    goto unwind2;
905  | 
906  | 		/**
907  | 		 **  Invalid facilities ... take care not to end up in 
908  | 		 **  infinite loops
909  | 		 **/
910  | 		if( Type == ERR_INVFAC ||
911  | 		    OK == ErrorLogger( ERR_INVFAC, LOC, fac, NULL))
912  | 		    continue;
913  | 		else
914  | 		    goto unwind2;
915  | 	    }
916  | 
917  | 	    fprintf( facfp, "%s", errmsg_buffer);
918  | 
919  | 	    if( EOF == fclose( facfp))
920  | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSE, LOC, fac, NULL))
921  | 		    goto unwind2;
922  | 
923  | 	}
924  |     } /** for **/
925  | 
926  |     /**
927  |      **  Return on success
928  |      **/
929  |     null_free((void *) &errmsg_buffer);
930  |     null_free((void *) &fac_buffer);
931  | success0:
932  |     return( 1);				/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
933  | 
934  | unwind2:
935  |     null_free((void *) &errmsg_buffer);
936  | unwind1:
937  |     null_free((void *) &fac_buffer);
938  | unwind0:
939  |     return( 0);				/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
940  | 
941  | } /** End of 'FlushError' **/
942  | 
943  | /*++++
944  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
945  |  ** 									     **
946  |  **   Function:		GetFacility					     **
947  |  ** 									     **
948  |  **   Description:	Get the log facility according to the passed error   **
949  |  **			weight						     **
950  |  ** 									     **
951  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/21					     **
952  |  ** 									     **
953  |  **   Parameters:	ErrWeights	  Weight	Error Weight	     **
954  |  ** 									     **
955  |  **   Result:		char*	NULL		No facility found	     **
956  |  **				Otherwise	Pointer to the colon separa- **
957  |  **						ted facility string	     **
958  |  ** 									     **
959  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
960  |  ++++*/
961  | 
962  | static	char	*GetFacility(	ErrWeights	  Weight)
963  | {
964  |     ErrFacilities	*facility;
965  | 
966  |     /**
967  |      **  Get the facility table entry at first
968  |      **/
969  |     if( !(facility = GetFacility_sub( Weight)))
970  | 	return((char *) NULL);
971  | 
972  |     /**
973  |      **  Now we've got two possibilities:
974  |      **      First of all there may be a custom facilitiy defined
975  |      **	     Otherwise the default facility is to be returned now
976  |      **/
977  |     return( facility->facility ? facility->facility : facility->def_facility);
978  | 
979  | } /** End of 'GetFacility' **/
980  | 
981  | static	ErrFacilities	*GetFacility_sub(	ErrWeights	  Weight)
982  | {
983  |     ErrFacilities	*low, *mid, *high, *save;
984  |     char		buffer[ 20];
985  | 
986  |     /**
987  |      **  Binary search for the passed facility in the Facilities table.
988  |      **  This requires the table to be sorted on ascending error weight
989  |      **/
990  |     low = Facilities;
991  |     high = Facilities + (sizeof( Facilities) / sizeof( Facilities[0]));
992  |     save = (ErrFacilities *) NULL;
993  |     mid = (ErrFacilities *) NULL;
994  | 
995  |     while( low < high) {
996  | 	save = mid;
997  | 	mid = low + ((high - low) / 2);
998  | 	if( save == mid)
999  | 	    low = mid = high;			/** Just to be sure ...	     **/
1000 | 
1001 | 	if( mid->Weight > Weight) 
1002 | 	    high = mid;
1003 | 	else if( mid->Weight < Weight)
1004 | 	    low = mid;
1005 | 	else
1006 | 	    break;	/** found! **/
1007 |     }
1008 | 
1009 |     /**
1010 |      **  We have to check, if we've found something or if there's an internal
1011 |      **  error (wrong weight)
1012 |      **/
1013 |     if( mid->Weight != Weight) {
1014 | 	if( OK == ErrorLogger( ERR_INVWGHT, LOC, (sprintf( buffer, "%d",
1015 | 	    Weight), buffer), NULL))
1016 | 	    return( NULL);
1017 |     }
1018 | 
1019 |     return( mid);
1020 | 
1021 | } /** End of 'GetFacility_sub' **/
1022 | 
1023 | /*++++
1024 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1025 |  ** 									     **
1026 |  **   Function:		CheckFacility					     **
1027 |  ** 									     **
1028 |  **   Description:	Check the passed string to be a valid combination    **
1029 |  **			of       <syslog_facility>.<syslog_level>	     **
1030 |  ** 									     **
1031 |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/21					     **
1032 |  ** 									     **
1033 |  **   Parameters:	char	*string		Input facility string	     **
1034 |  **			int	*facility	Buffer for the real facility **
1035 |  **			int	*level		Buffer for the real level    **
1036 |  ** 									     **
1037 |  **   Result:		int	1		Success			     **
1038 |  **				0		Failure. String not valid    **
1039 |  ** 									     **
1040 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1041 |  ++++*/
1042 | 
1043 | int	CheckFacility(	char *string, int *facility, int *level)
1044 | {
1045 |     char *s, *buf;
1046 |     int x;
1047 | 
1048 |     /**
1049 |      **  We do not want to change the strings ... so allocate a buffer here
1050 |      **/
1051 |     if((char *) NULL == (buf = stringer(NULL,0, string,NULL)))
1052 | 	if( OK == ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
1053 | 	    goto unwind0;
1054 | 
1055 |     /** 
1056 |      **  We cannot use strtok here, because there's one initialized in an
1057 |      **  outer loop!
1058 |      **/
1059 |     for( s=buf; s && *s && *s != '.'; s++);
1060 |     if( !s || !*s)
1061 | 	goto unwind1;
1062 |     *s = '\0';
1063 | 	
1064 |     /**
1065 |      **  This should be the facility
1066 |      **/
1067 |     if( -1 == (x = scan_facility( buf, facility_names,
1068 | 	    (sizeof( facility_names) / sizeof( facility_names[0])) )))
1069 | 	goto unwind1;
1070 |     *facility = x;
1071 | 
1072 |     /**
1073 |      **  This should be the level
1074 |      **/
1075 |     if( -1 == (x = scan_facility( ++s, level_names, 
1076 | 	    (sizeof( level_names) / sizeof( level_names[0])) )))
1077 | 	goto unwind1;
1078 |     *level = x;
1079 | 
1080 |     /**
1081 |      **  Success
1082 |      **/
1083 |     null_free((void *) &buf);
1084 |     return( 1);				/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
1085 | 
1086 | unwind1:
1087 |     null_free((void *) &buf);
1088 | unwind0:
1089 |     return( 0);				/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
1090 | 
1091 | } /** End of 'CheckFacility' **/
1092 | 
1093 | /*++++
1094 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1095 |  ** 									     **
1096 |  **   Function:		scan_facility					     **
1097 |  ** 									     **
1098 |  **   Description:	Scan the passed facility names table for the given   **
1099 |  **			string and pass back the assigned token		     **
1100 |  ** 									     **
1101 |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/21					     **
1102 |  ** 									     **
1103 |  **   Parameters:	char		*s	String to be checked	     **
1104 |  **			FacilityNames	*table	Table of valid names and     **
1105 |  **						tokens			     **
1106 |  **			int		 size	Size of the table	     **
1107 |  ** 									     **
1108 |  **   Result:		int	-1		name not found in the table  **
1109 |  **				Otherwise	Assigned token		     **
1110 |  ** 									     **
1111 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1112 |  ++++*/
1113 | 
1114 | static	int	scan_facility( char *s, FacilityNames *table, int size)
1115 | {
1116 |     FacilityNames *low, *mid, *high, *save;
1117 | 
1118 |     low = table;
1119 |     high = table + size;
1120 |     save = (FacilityNames *) NULL;
1121 | 
1122 |     while( low < high) {
1123 | 	int x;			/** Have to use this, because strcmp will    **/
1124 | 				/** not return -1 and 1 on Solaris 2.x	     **/
1125 | 	save = mid;
1126 | 	mid = low + ((high - low) / 2);
1127 | 	if( save == mid)
1128 | 	    low = mid = high;			/** To prevent endless loops **/
1129 | 
1130 | 	if (mid == high)
1131 | 		return -1;
1132 | 	x = strcmp( mid->name, s);
1133 | 
1134 | 	if( x < 0 )
1135 | 	    low = mid;
1136 | 	else if( x > 0)
1137 | 	    high = mid;
1138 | 	else
1139 | 	    return( mid->token);
1140 | 
1141 |     } /** while **/
1142 | 
1143 |     return( !strcmp( mid->name, s) ? mid->token : -1 );
1144 | 
1145 | } /** End of 'scan_facility' **/
1146 | 
1147 | /*++++
1148 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1149 |  ** 									     **
1150 |  **   Function:		GetFacilityPtr					     **
1151 |  ** 									     **
1152 |  **   Description:	Scan the passed facility names table for the given   **
1153 |  **			string and pass back the assigned token		     **
1154 |  ** 									     **
1155 |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/21					     **
1156 |  ** 									     **
1157 |  **   Parameters:	char	*facility	Name of the facility	     **
1158 |  ** 									     **
1159 |  **   Result:		char**	NULL		Invalid facility name	     **
1160 |  **				Otherwise	Pointer to the facilty string**
1161 |  **						reference		     **
1162 |  ** 									     **
1163 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1164 |  ++++*/
1165 | 
1166 | char	**GetFacilityPtr( char *facility)
1167 | {
1168 |     int		 	 i, len;
1169 |     ErrMeasr		*measptr;
1170 |     char		*buf, *t;
1171 |     ErrFacilities	*facptr;
1172 | 
1173 |     /**
1174 |      **  Try to figure out the error weight at first
1175 |      **  Need the given weight in upper case for this
1176 |      **/
1177 |     len = strlen( facility);
1178 | 
1179 |     if((char *) NULL == (buf = stringer(NULL, 0, facility, NULL)))
1180 | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
1181 | 	    goto unwind0;
1182 | 
1183 |     for( t = buf; *t; ++t) *t = toupper(*t);
1184 |     
1185 |     /**
1186 |      **  Now look up the measurements table for the uppercase weight
1187 |      **/
1188 |     i = sizeof( Measurements) / sizeof( Measurements[ 0]);
1189 |     measptr = Measurements;
1190 | 
1191 |     while( i) {
1192 | 	if( !strncmp( measptr->message, buf, len))
1193 | 	    break;
1194 | 	i--; measptr++;
1195 |     }
1196 | 
1197 |     null_free((void *) &buf);
1198 | 
1199 |     if( !i) 					/** not found		     **/
1200 | 	goto unwind0;
1201 |     
1202 |     /**
1203 |      **  Now get the facility table entry
1204 |      **/
1205 | 
1206 |     if((ErrFacilities *) NULL == (facptr = GetFacility_sub(
1207 | 	measptr->error_weight))) {
1208 | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_INVWGHT_WARN, LOC, facility, NULL); 
1209 | 	goto unwind0;
1210 |     }
1211 | 
1212 |     /**
1213 |      **  Got it ... return the desired pointer
1214 |      **/
1215 |     return( &facptr->facility);		/** -------- EXIT (RESULT)  -------> **/
1216 | 
1217 | unwind0:
1218 |     return((char **) NULL);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
1219 | 
1220 | } /** End of 'GetFacilityPtr' **/
1221 | 
1222 | /*++++
1223 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1224 |  ** 									     **
1225 |  **   Function:		PrintError					     **
1226 |  ** 									     **
1227 |  **   Description:	Print the error message				     **
1228 |  ** 									     **
1229 |  **   First Edition:	1995/08/06					     **
1230 |  ** 									     **
1231 |  **   Parameters:	char             *errbuffer	Buffer to hold the   **
1232 |  **							error messge	     **
1233 |  **			ErrType		  Type		Error type as passed **
1234 |  **			char		 *module	Module name	     **
1235 |  **			int		  lineno	Line number	     **
1236 |  **		  	ErrWeights	  Weight	Error Weight	     **
1237 |  **			char		 *WeightMsg	Printable Weight     **
1238 |  **			char		 *ErrMsgs	Error message	     **
1239 |  **			int		  argc		Number of arguments  **
1240 |  **			char		**argv		Argument array	     **
1241 |  ** 									     **
1242 |  **   Result:		int	1		Everything OK		     **
1243 |  **				0		Error occured while printing **
1244 |  ** 									     **
1245 |  **   Notes:	According to the error type, the passed module and line num- **
1246 |  **		ber will be handled as a module-file related one or depending**
1247 |  **		on the packages source code:				     **
1248 |  **									     **
1249 |  **		src -> ERR_IN_MODULEFILE -> modulefile -> ERR_INTERNAL -> src**
1250 |  ** 									     **
1251 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1252 |  ++++*/
1253 | 
1254 | static	int	PrintError(	char 		 *errbuffer,
1255 | 				ErrType		  Type,
1256 | 				char		 *module,
1257 | 				int		  lineno,
1258 | 				ErrWeights	  Weight,
1259 | 				char		 *WeightMsg,
1260 | 				char		 *ErrMsgs,
1261 | 				int		  argc,
1262 | 				char		**argv)
1263 | {
1264 |     char	*error_string;
1265 | 
1266 |     /**
1267 |      **  Build the error string at first. Note - we cannot alloc memory any
1268 |      **  more!
1269 |      **/
1270 |     if( ERR_ALLOC == Type) 
1271 | 	error_string = ErrMsgs;
1272 |     else
1273 | 	if( NULL == (error_string = ErrorString( ErrMsgs, argc, argv)))
1274 | 	    return( 0);
1275 | 
1276 |     /**
1277 |      **  Print
1278 |      **/
1279 | 
1280 |     if( ERR_INTERNAL > Type && ERR_IN_MODULEFILE < Type &&
1281 | 	linenum && g_current_module )
1282 | 
1283 | 	sprintf( errbuffer, "%s(%s):%s:%d: %s\n", g_current_module,
1284 | 	    (sprintf( buffer, "%d", linenum), buffer),
1285 | 	    WeightMsg, Type, (error_string ? error_string : "") );
1286 |     else
1287 | 
1288 | 	sprintf( errbuffer, "%s(%s):%s:%d: %s\n", (module ? module : "??"),
1289 | 	    ( lineno ? (sprintf( buffer, "%d", lineno), buffer) : "??" ),
1290 | 	    WeightMsg, Type, (error_string ? error_string : "") );
1291 | 
1292 |     /**
1293 |      **  Success
1294 |      **/
1295 |     return( 1);
1296 | 
1297 | } /** End of 'PrintError' **/
1298 | 
1299 | /*++++
1300 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1301 |  ** 									     **
1302 |  **   Function:		ErrorString					     **
1303 |  ** 									     **
1304 |  **   Description:	Format the error message			     **
1305 |  ** 									     **
1306 |  **   First Edition:	1995/08/06					     **
1307 |  ** 									     **
1308 |  **   Parameters:	char		 *ErrMsgs	Error message	     **
1309 |  **			int		  argc		Number of arguments  **
1310 |  **			char		**argv		Argument array	     **
1311 |  ** 									     **
1312 |  **   Result:		char*	NULL		Parse or alloc error	     **
1313 |  **				else		Pointer to the error string  **
1314 |  ** 									     **
1315 |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
1316 |  **									     **
1317 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1318 |  ++++*/
1319 | 
1320 | static	char	*ErrorString(	char		 *ErrMsgs,
1321 | 				int		  argc,
1322 | 				char		**argv)
1323 | {
1324 |     char	*s;			/** Insertion pointer		     **/
1325 |     char	*X,*XErrMsgs;		/** gettext string pointer	     **/
1326 |     int		len = 0;		/** Current length		     **/
1327 |     int		backslash = 0;		/** backslash found ?		     **/
1328 | 
1329 |     if( !ErrMsgs)
1330 | 	return( NULL);
1331 | 
1332 |     /**
1333 |      **  Allocate memory if neccessary
1334 |      **/
1335 |     if( !error_line)
1336 | 	if((char *) NULL ==(error_line = stringer(NULL,strsize = ERR_LINELEN,
1337 | 		NULL))){
1338 | 	    ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
1339 | 	    return( NULL);
1340 | 	}
1341 | 
1342 |     s = error_line;
1343 |     X = XErrMsgs = _(ErrMsgs);
1344 | 
1345 |     /**
1346 |      **  Scan the error strings to be printed
1347 |      **/
1348 |     while( *X ) {
1349 | 
1350 | 	/**
1351 | 	 **  Check for special characters
1352 | 	 **/
1353 | 	switch( *X) {
1354 | 	    case '\\':	if( !backslash) {
1355 | 				backslash = 1;
1356 | 				X++;
1357 | 				continue;	/** while( *ErrMsgs) **/
1358 | 			    }
1359 | 			    break;	/** switch **/
1360 | 
1361 | 	    case '$':	if( !backslash) {
1362 | 				X++;
1363 | 				add_param( &X, &s, &len, argc, argv);
1364 | 				error_line = s - len;
1365 | 				continue;	/** while( *ErrMsgs) **/
1366 | 			    }
1367 | 			    break;	/** switch **/
1368 | 	} /** switch **/
1369 | 
1370 | 	/**
1371 | 	 **  Add a single character to the error string
1372 | 	 **/
1373 | 	if( ++len >= strsize - 5) {	/** 5 Bytes for safety		     **/
1374 | 	    if( NULL == (error_line = (char *) module_realloc( error_line,
1375 | 		strsize += ERR_LINELEN))) {
1376 | 		ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1377 | 		return( NULL);
1378 | 	    }
1379 | 	    s = error_line + len - 1;
1380 | 	}
1381 | 
1382 | 	*s++ = *X++;
1383 | 	backslash = 0;
1384 | 				
1385 |     } /** while( *ErrMsgs) **/
1386 | 
1387 |     /**
1388 |      **  Success. Return a pointer to the newly created string
1389 |      **/
1390 |     *s++ = '\0';
1391 |     return( error_line);
1392 | 
1393 | } /** End of 'ErrorString' **/
1394 | 
1395 | /*++++
1396 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1397 |  ** 									     **
1398 |  **   Function:		add_param					     **
1399 |  ** 									     **
1400 |  **   Description:	Put an argument to the error string		     **
1401 |  ** 									     **
1402 |  **   First Edition:	1995/08/06					     **
1403 |  ** 									     **
1404 |  **   Parameters:	char		**Control	Parameter control    **
1405 |  **			char		**Target	Target to print to   **
1406 |  **			int		 *Length	Current length of the**
1407 |  **							output string	     **
1408 |  **			int		  argc		Number of arguments  **
1409 |  **			char		**argv		Argument array	     **
1410 |  ** 									     **
1411 |  **   Result:		-						     **
1412 |  ** 									     **
1413 |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
1414 |  **									     **
1415 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1416 |  ++++*/
1417 | 
1418 | static	void	add_param(	char		**Control,
1419 | 				char		**Target,
1420 | 				int		 *Length,
1421 | 				int		  argc,
1422 | 				char		**argv)
1423 | {
1424 |     char	*s;			/** Scan pointer for the ctrl field  **/
1425 |     int		index, last = 0;	/** parameter index		     **/
1426 |     int		len = 0;		/** Parameter string length	     **/
1427 | 
1428 |     /**
1429 |      **  Copy the current control field into the buffer
1430 |      **/
1431 | 
1432 |     for( s = buffer; **Control; (*Control)++ ) {
1433 | 
1434 | 	if( **Control == '*') {
1435 | 	    last = argc;
1436 | 	    continue;
1437 | 	} else if( **Control < '0' || **Control > '9')
1438 | 	    break;
1439 | 
1440 | 	*s++ = **Control;
1441 |     }
1442 | 
1443 |     *s = '\0';
1444 | 
1445 |     /**
1446 |      **  Has something been found ? If not, print a '$'
1447 |      **/
1448 |     if( s == buffer && !last) {
1449 | 
1450 | 	if( ++(*Length) >= strsize) {
1451 | 	    if( NULL == (error_line = (char*) module_realloc( error_line,
1452 | 		strsize += ERR_LINELEN))) {
1453 | 		ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1454 | 		return;
1455 | 	    }
1456 | 	    *Target = error_line + *Length - 1;
1457 | 	}
1458 | 
1459 | 	*(*Target++) = '$';
1460 | 
1461 |     } else {
1462 | 
1463 | 	/**
1464 | 	 **  Something has been found. Form the parameter index at first
1465 | 	 **/
1466 | 	if( s == buffer)
1467 | 	    index = 0;
1468 | 	else
1469 | 	    index = atoi( buffer) - 1;
1470 | 
1471 | 	if( !last)
1472 | 	    last = index + 1;
1473 | 	if( last > argc)
1474 | 	    last = argc;
1475 | 
1476 | 	/**
1477 | 	 **  Spool them all out
1478 | 	 **/
1479 | 	while( index < last) {
1480 | 
1481 | 	    len = strlen( argv[ index]);
1482 | 
1483 | 	    while(( *Length + len + 1) >= strsize - 5) {
1484 | 		if( NULL == (error_line = (char*) module_realloc( error_line,
1485 | 		    strsize += ERR_LINELEN))) {
1486 | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1487 | 		    return;
1488 | 		}
1489 | 		*Target = error_line + *Length;
1490 | 	    }
1491 | 
1492 | 	    strcpy( *Target, argv[ index]);
1493 | 	    *Target += len;
1494 | 	    *Length += len;
1495 | 
1496 | 	    index++;
1497 | 
1498 | 	} /** while **/
1499 |     } /** if **/
1500 | 
1501 | } /** End of 'add_param' **/
